sentences: Nad on ju kuramuse tore paar.
context: The word 'kuramuse' is an intensifier adverb in Estonian used to emphasize the quality of something, typically expressing that something is very or extremely good or bad. It can be translated as 'terribly', 'awfully', or 'dreadfully'. The dictionary examples show it modifying nouns (bad weather, good herb) and phrases (fine pair).
